To be more precise, the unit that Nganasan uses is not the syllable but the mora. The difference is that a long vowel counts as one syllable but two morae. Since long vowels are not of Proto-Uralic date, the syllable coincides with the mora in Proto-Uralic
In non-initial syllables, the loss of *w after vowels had created the vowels y, u, o, which did not exist in Finno-Saamic
